## Introduction:  

This script is for visualisation of the output of gene ontology (GO) analyses using the R package TopGo.
This script creates a barchart of the number of significant genes annotated to a particular GO term, with an associated p-value. This script takes an input of .csv files containing an output table of GO analyses.

```{r, message = FALSE}
# Load libraries; install from scratch if needed
libraries <- c("ggplot2",
               "lattice",
               "ggpubr")
for (lib in libraries) {
    if (require(package = lib, character.only = TRUE)) {
        print("Successful")
    } else {
        print("Installing")
        source("https://bioconductor.org/biocLite.R")
        library(lib, character.only = TRUE)
    }
}

## Create output directory:
dir.create("results/figures/",
           recursive = TRUE)
```

## Step One: Load input files
Read in files for the output of Gene Ontology enrichment analysis.

Load results from diapause samples:

```{r, message = FALSE}
## Read in biological processes GO terms:
bp_terms <- read.table(file = "input/go_term_input/BP_sig.tsv",
                       header = TRUE)
bp_terms$category <- "BP"

## Read in molecular function GO terms:
mf_terms <- read.table(file = "input/go_term_input/MF_sig.tsv",
                       header = TRUE)
mf_terms$category <- "MF"

## Read in molecular function GO terms:
cc_terms <- read.table(file = "input/go_term_input/CC_sig.tsv",
                       header = TRUE)
cc_terms$category <- "CC"
```

For each time-point, combine gene ontolgy terms for plotting:

```{r, message = FALSE}
## Combine GO terms:
combined_terms <- rbind(bp_terms,
                        mf_terms,
                        cc_terms)
combined_terms$category <- factor(combined_terms$category)

## Set order of GO categories to plot
levels(combined_terms$category) <- c("BP", "MF", "CC")

## Log transform p values for plotting:
combined_terms$weight_ks_adjusted <- -log(combined_terms$weight_ks_adjusted)

## For plotting, update GO term names to include total number of annotated terms:
combined_terms$updated_terms <- paste(combined_terms$Term,
                                      " ",
                                      "(",
                                      combined_terms$Annotated,
                                      ")",
                                      sep = "")

## Remove underscore:
combined_terms$updated_terms <- gsub("_", " ", combined_terms$updated_terms)

## Generate plot:
combined_terms_plot <- ggbarplot(combined_terms,
                                 x = "updated_terms",
                                 y = "weight_ks_adjusted",
                                 position = position_dodge(0.1),
                                 fill = "category",
                                 color = "category",
                                 palette = "jco",
                                 sort.val = "desc",
                                 sort.by.groups = TRUE,
                                 ylab = "-log10(p)",
                                 xlab = "Gene Ontology terms enriched in genes with strongest |nsl| scores",
                                 legend.title = "Gene Ontology",
                                 lab.col = "black",
                                 lab.size = 2,
                                 lab.vjust = 0.5,
                                 lab.hjust = 1,
                                 short.panel.labs = FALSE,
                                 legend = "top",
                                 rotate = FALSE,
                                 ggtheme = theme_minimal())

## Make font bigger and bold:
combined_terms_plot <- combined_terms_plot +
        scale_y_continuous(expand = c(0, 2)) +
        theme(axis.text.x = element_text(size = 10,
                                         angle = 90,
                                         hjust = 0.95,
                                         vjust = 0.2),
              axis.text = element_text(size = 15),
              axis.title.x = element_text(size = 15,
                                          face = "bold"),
              axis.title.y = element_text(size = 15,
                                          face = "bold"),
              axis.text.y = element_text(size = 10,
                                         face = "plain"),
              legend.position = "top",
              legend.title = element_text(size = 10,
                                          face = "bold")) +
        geom_hline(yintercept = 1.301,
                   linetype = "dashed",
                   colour = "black")

## Print to console:
combined_terms_plot

## Save picture:
ggsave(file = "results/figures/combined_go_terms_barchart.png",
       height = 10,
       width = 15)

## Save picture:
ggsave(file = "results/figures/combined_go_terms_barchart.pdf",
       dpi = 600,
       height = 10,
       width = 15)

## Save as R object:
save(combined_terms_plot,
     file = "./results/figures/combined_go_terms_barchart.RData")
```
